inkball

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PApplet
      • inkball.App
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants

    public class App
extends processing.core.PApplet

    This the main class which represents the game window, inheriting the PApplet class from the Processing library to handle drawing graphics.

    The App instance stores data like the game board components, the current game level and time. This class is responsible for overall game logic such as real-time line-drawing, pause/win/lose/restart scenarios, and map modifications. Protected modifiers are to adhere to encapsulation whilst allowing the corresponding testing class AppTest to access relevant attributes.

        Overrides:
        settings in class processing.core.PApplet

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Initializes and sets up the game environment. This method overrides PApplet's setup method.

        This method performs the following major tasks:

        1. Loads and processes configuration data from a JSON file.
        2. Sets up game parameters such as frame rate, time limit, and score modifiers.
        3. Initializes score increase and decrease mappings for different colors.
        4. Loads necessary sprite resources.
        5. Creates the game board.
        6. Sets up the initial ball queue based on configuration.
        Overrides:
        setup in class processing.core.PApplet

      • getFileContents

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getFileContents()
        Gets the layout file from the JSONObject json.
        Returns:
        the contents of the file in nested ArrayList of strings (if layout file exists), null otherwise.
        Note: When testing, a dummy file is created instead with the name "for-texting.txt". This file is deleted at the end of the method call.

      • setLayout

        public void setLayout()
        Sets up the game board layout based on file contents and initializes game objects.

        This method performs the following major tasks:

        1. Reads the layout file contents.
        2. Iterates through the board grid, creating game objects based on file symbols.
        3. Handles cases of insufficient file data by filling with blank tiles.
        4. Initializes walls, holes, spawners, and balls according to the layout.
        5. Adds border lines to the game board.
        Note:

        Layout symbols and their meanings:

        • " " (space): Blank tile
        • "X": Wall (color 0)
        • "1"-"4": Colored walls
        • "H": Hole (followed by color code)
        • "S": Spawner
        • "B": Ball (followed by color code)

        Special considerations:

        • Handles cases where file data is shorter than expected board dimensions.
        • Skips already populated board positions.
        • Positions balls slightly offset from grid for centered appearance.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Restarts the game. Clears existing elements and resets the score to 0 or the score from the previous level when applicable.

      • moveSpiral

        public int[] moveSpiral(int[] spiral)
        Modifies the input coordinates so that it follows a clockwise spiral. This method will always return an integer array
        Parameters:
        spiral - the xy-coordinate position of the object meant to move in a spiral.
        Returns:
        integer array of coordinates after being moved in the spiral direction.

      • spawnBalls

        public void spawnBalls()
        Manages the spawning of balls in the game based on a queue system.
        This method is responsible for:
        1. Checking if there are balls in the queue to spawn.
        2. Spawning a new ball at regular intervals from a random spawner.
        3. Managing the ball queue after spawning.
        The method uses frameCount and spawnInterval to determine when to spawn a new ball. Balls are spawned from random spawner locations. After spawning, the queue is reorganized, removing the spawned ball and shifting others. Returns early if ballQueue has not been properly initialised or is empty (ballQueue[0] is null).

      • colourToInt

        public int colourToInt(java.lang.String colourStr)
        Returns the integer representation of the input using the colour scale of Inkball: grey = 0, orange = 1, blue = 2, green = 3, yellow = 4, others = 0.
        Parameters:
        colourStr - string representation of a colour
        Returns:
        integer representation of colourStr

      • addBorders

        public void addBorders()
        Adds border lines to the game area and wall segments for all Wall tiles.
        This method performs two main tasks:
        1. Creates four invisible border lines around the entire game area.
        2. Adds line segments for each Wall tile in the game board.
        Border lines are created slightly outside the visible game area (32 pixels) to ensure complete coverage. These lines are invisible (isDrawn = false) and have a color code of 0. For each Wall tile in the board, addWallLineSegment() is called to add its individual line segments.

      • addWallLineSegment

        public void addWallLineSegment(Wall wall)
        Gets the line segments representing the top, left, bottom, and right sides of the wall and adds the segments to app.allLines
        Parameters:
        wall - The Wall object for which to generate line segments.

      • getWallLineSegments

        public Line[] getWallLineSegments(Wall wall)
        Generates an array of Line objects representing the four sides of a Wall.
        Parameters:
        wall - The Wall object for which to generate line segments.
        Returns:
        An array of four Line objects representing the top, left, bottom, and right sides of the wall. Each Line object contains:
        - Start and end coordinates adjusted for cell size and top bar offset
        - The color of the wall
        - A boolean indicating if the line is drawn (set to false by default)

      • getColourCode

        public int getColourCode(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> lines,
                         int i,
                         int j)
        Retrieves the color code from a 2D ArrayList of Strings at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        lines - The 2D ArrayList containing color information.
        i - The row index in the ArrayList.
        j - The column index in the ArrayList. The color code is expected to be at j+1.
        Returns:
        The color code as an integer. Returns -1 if: - The specified position is out of bounds - The color string is empty - The color string cannot be parsed as an integer - The parsed integer is not in the range 0-4
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified indices are out of range (caught internally)
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the color string cannot be parsed as an integer (caught internally)

      • getPosition

        public Hole.GridPosition getPosition(int k,
                                     int l)
        Determines the grid position of a hole based on given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        k - The x-coordinate in a 2x2 grid (0 or 1)
        l - The y-coordinate in a 2x2 grid (0 or 1)
        Returns:
        A Hole.GridPosition enum value representing the position: - TL (TopLeft) for (0,0) - TR (TopRight) for (1,0) - BL (BottomLeft) for (0,1) - BR (BottomRight) for (1,1) Returns null if the coordinates are out of the 2x2 range.

      • getDistance

        public static double getDistance(float[] P1,
                                 float[] P2)
        Overloaded method: Determines the distance between two points with float-coordinates.
        Parameters:
        P1 - The coordinates of the first point.
        P2 - The coordinates of the second point.
        Returns:
        A double value representing the distance between both points.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if:
        • P1 is null and/or;
        • P2 is null and/or;
        • P1 is not in xy-coordinate format and/or;
        • P2 is not in xy-coordinate.

      • getDistance

        public static double getDistance(double[] P1,
                                 float[] P2)
        Overloaded method: Determines the distance between two points, the first with double-coordinates and the second with float-coordinates
        Parameters:
        P1 - The coordinates of the first point.
        P2 - The coordinates of the second point.
        Returns:
        A double value representing the distance between both points.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if: - P1 is null and/or; - P2 is null and/or; - P1 is not in xy-coordinate format and/or; - P2 is not in xy-coordinate format.

      • addDrawnLine

        public void addDrawnLine(Line line)
        Adds user-drawn lines to tempLines.

        Does not add the line if line is drawn on the window top bar. Adds line segment to the most recent line group in tempLines.

        Parameters:
        line - The line segment to be added to tempLines.

      • removeLine

        public void removeLine(float[] toRemove)
        Overloaded method: Removes a line from the game based on the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        toRemove - An array of floats representing the coordinates of the point to remove. Expected to be in the format [x, y].
        Note: The method searches for a line that contains the given point, starting from the most recently drawn lines (end of the list) and moving backwards. Once found, it removes the entire list containing that line from both drawnLines and tempLines. If no line is found containing the given point, the method returns without making any changes.

      • removeLine

        public void removeLine(Line toRemove)
        Removes a specific line and its associated group from the game.
        Parameters:
        toRemove - The Line object to be removed.
        Note: The method searches for the specified line in drawnLines, starting from the most recently drawn lines (end of the list) and moving backwards. Once found, it removes the entire group (List) containing that line from both drawnLines and tempLines. If the specified line is not found, the method returns without making any changes.

      • mouseOnLine

        public boolean mouseOnLine(float[] mouseXY,
                           float[] lineP1,
                           float[] lineP2)
        Determines if the mouse is on or near a line segment.
        Parameters:
        mouseXY - An array of two floats representing the mouse coordinates [x, y].
        lineP1 - An array of two floats representing the coordinates of one endpoint of the line segment [x1, y1].
        lineP2 - An array of two floats representing the coordinates of the other endpoint of the line segment [x2, y2].
        Returns:
        true if the mouse is considered to be on the line segment, false otherwise.

      • getWallAssociated

        public Wall[] getWallAssociated(Ball ball,
                                Line line)
        Determines the walls associated with a potential collision between a ball and a line.
        Parameters:
        ball - The Ball object involved in the potential collision.
        line - The Line object involved in the potential collision.
        Returns:
        An array of Wall objects. The first element is the closest wall to the collision point from app.walls, and the second element is the wall at the same board position as the closest wall. Returns null if no collision is detected or if no associated walls are found. The method first checks for a collision using the ball's willCollide method. If a collision is detected, it finds the closest wall to the collision point. It then attempts to find a second wall at the same board position as the closest wall.

      • removeWall

        public void removeWall(Wall wall)
        Removes a specified wall from the game, including its line segments and board representation.
        Parameters:
        wall - The Wall object to be removed from the game. The method performs the following steps: 1. Retrieves the line segments associated with the wall. 2. Searches for these line segments in the allLines list. 3. If found, removes the line segments from allLines. 4. Removes the wall from the walls collection. 5. Replaces the wall in the board array with a new Blank object.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(processing.event.KeyEvent event)
        Handles key press events in the game. This method overrides the keyPressed method from the parent PApplet class.
        Overrides:
        keyPressed in class processing.core.PApplet
        Parameters:
        event - The KeyEvent object containing information about the key press.

        The method performs the following actions based on key presses: - 'r' key (code 82): Restarts the game, resets timer, and sets game state to PLAYING. - Spacebar (code 32): Toggles between PAUSED and PLAYING states. - Ctrl key (code 17): Sets ctrlPressed flag to true.

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased()
        Handles key released events in the game. This method overrides the keyReleased method from the parent PApplet class.
        The method sets ctrlPressed flag to true when the Ctrl key (code 17) is released.
        Overrides:
        keyReleased in class processing.core.PApplet

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(processing.event.MouseEvent e)
        Handles mouse press events in the game. This method overrides the mousePressed method from the parent PApplet class.
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class processing.core.PApplet
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseEvent object containing information about the mouse press.

        The method performs the following actions based on mouse presses: 1. Left click (button 37):
        • With Ctrl modifier: Removes a line at the clicked position.
        • Without Ctrl: Starts or continues drawing a line.
        2. Right click (button 39): Removes a line at the clicked position.
        The method only processes mouse events if the game state is PLAYING.

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(processing.event.MouseEvent e)
        Handles mouse drag events in the game. This method overrides the mouseDragged method from the parent PApplet class.
        Overrides:
        mouseDragged in class processing.core.PApplet
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseEvent object containing information about the mouse drag.

        The method performs the following actions:
        - Only processes events if the game state is PLAYING.
        For left mouse button drags (button 37):
        - Continues drawing a line if already drawing.
        - Starts drawing a new line if not already drawing.
        - Updates the end point of the current line segment.
        - Adds a new line segment if enough frames have passed since the last segment.

        The method uses the addDrawnLine method to add new line segments.

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(processing.event.MouseEvent e)
        Handles mouse release events in the game. This method overrides the mouseReleased method from the parent class.
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class processing.core.PApplet
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseEvent object containing information about the mouse release.

        The method performs the following actions: - Only processes events if the game state is PLAYING.
        For left mouse button releases:
        - Finalizes the current line being drawn if isDrawing is true.
        - Adds the completed line to drawnLines.
        - Updates lastLine with the current frameCount.
        - Sets isDrawing to false, ending the drawing process.

        The method uses the addDrawnLine method to add the final line segment.

      • drawAll

        public void drawAll()
        Executes main game logic and facilitates interaction between game components.

        Methods used: Wall::damage, Ball::willCollide, Ball::interact, Ball::meetHole, Ball:: moveOne, removeLine, removeWall, getWallAssociated

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draw all elements in the game by current frame. Draws timer and score components. Calls the drawAll method. Calls spawnBalls and handles different gameState scenarios, including the win spiral animation.
        Overrides:
        draw in class processing.core.PApplet
